> <OLD>
>
>
> Hydras opened his comlink and said "To al PRedacons concentra=
te your
> fire powers in the door, as soon as is down retreat!!!" he opened=

> fire against the door

<NEW>

As Uproar hits the ground and rolls, landi=
ng against a large stone, oddly
enough Cyclonus does not follow up the atta=
ck. Instead he responds to
Hydras=92 call to target the Ark=92s door. With =
a quick twist and flare from his
boosters he lines himself up with Hydras a=
nd prepares to follow his orders.

> <OLD>
>
> Quickstride now gets sick an=
d tired of Waspinator's torment as he too,
breaks out the big guns against =
his flying foe.
>
> "Yeah, well, I'm gettn' pretty sick of you dropping you=
r bombs on me too,
bug aft!"
>
> He throws continuous rounds from his large=
 blast cannon while deflecting
Waspinator's blasts.
>
> "TIME FOR SOME MAJO=
R PEST CONTROL! THIS'LL MAKE YA WISH YA NEVER GOT OUTA
YOUR HIVE THIS MORNI=
NG!"
>
> As it was for equine nature, Quickstride shows a severe dislike to=

Waspinator, hoping one day he would swat the servos out of him in his wasp=

mode, with his long, copper tail while in his own equine beast mode.

<NEW=
>

It would seem that Quickstride is more successful against Waspinator tha=
n
Uproar was against Cyclonus. Quockstride=92s large blast cannon fires
rep=
eatedly into the air keeping the vicious Predacon at bay. One of his
attack=
s catches him in the fuselage sending Waspinator spinning through the
air o=
nce more, smoke trailing behind him.

=93Waspinator hate all this!=94 he sa=
id as he sailed away!

> <OLD>
>
> Windlord and Kup continue firing against=
 Scourge and Deepstrike.

<NEW>

As Windlord and Kup continue their firefig=
ht, Scourge swung out around them,
forcing them to change their attacks and=
 swing with him. Meanwhile
Deepstryke moved higher up and the other way, sw=
inging his multiple cannon
mounts around at the same time. However instead =
of firing at Kup or Windlord
he targets the door to the Ark!

MEANWHILE INS=
IDE THE ARK:

> <OLD>
>
> He thinks for a moment. This was a great way to c=
ommunicate because
Nightrazor may not have any idea that Tucson was still a=
ble to communicate
in this mode. He raises an optic and continues to tap hi=
s shoulder.
>
> " Don't take this the wrong way Rodimus, but it's the only =
way we can
communicate in a way that Nightrazor has no notion of us doing s=
o. Feel free
to do the same, use the morse coding, it will help us understa=
nd each other
to apprehend him sufficiantly."

<NEW>

As Tuscon had his han=
ds on Rodimus to pass the message he could feel Rodimus
move in the darknes=
s, presumably nodding his head in understanding.
=93Gotcha!=94 Rodimus tapp=
ed back, knowing the code Tuscon was using.

=93Need move quick=94 Rodimus =
tapped back quickly, =93Intruder not wait us talk.=94

Rodimus motioned for=
 them to spread out, =93Your senses better, find switch=94
he tapped again.=


> <OLD>
>
> He stops to feel the vibrations of the floor. Then he puts ou=
t his hand to
sense vibrations in the air. Through that, he could get a fai=
nt idea as to
how the air circulates around various objects. A cross breeze=
 as stale as it
was, would navigate him toward an emergency generator switc=
h. He follows
that breeze, and extends his hand out to touch it, slowly com=
ming to the
device. With another raise of the brow he carefully throws the =
switch and
waits to see what happens.

<NEW>

Actually as Tuscon was just a=
bout to the generator control, but before he
could pull it he found that he=
 did not need to!

In moving he had stepped out of the field of darkness an=
d with a blink he
could hear and his radar/sonar snapped back on, all senso=
rs were a go!

However any scan back to where he came from would show that =
where he was
standing there was a large ball of darkness several meters acr=
oss that he
could not scan, it was a globe of darkness and silence.

Rodimu=
s stepped out of the other side of the globe blinking also obviously
his se=
nsors were coming back online too. He looked around, =93Where is the . .
. =
.

>>KABOOM!!<<

With a deafening explosion the main door exploded off its =
hinges as the
combined power of Cyclonus, Hydras, Deepstryke and several ot=
her predacons
blasted it! Fortunately the fallen bodies of the Autobots and=
 Decepticons
were too far away to receive more than a little rumbling and s=
moke, nothing
that would significantly impact their slumber and their event=
ual awakening.

Meanwhile . . .

> <OLD>
>
> "We must be carefull"said Talo=
n with a moan, the pain was unbearable.
>
> "Can you set me in stasis???"sa=
is Talon with pain"I donat know how
> much longer i could bear this pain...=
"

<NEW>

Evidently whomever had placed Talon down had left Talon is a well=
 shielded
place, there was no damage to this Maximal as well. The console t=
hat was
between Talon and the door snapped off and was flung across the roo=
m, but
Talon continued to lay there, his systems merciful shutting him down=
,
sending him into stasis lock.

> <OLD>
>
> Perceptor tried to seal all th=
e corritors that lead to the sleep
> decepticons and autobots. He worked as=
 fast as he could.

<NEW>

Perceptor could not seal off the room that the A=
utobots were in simply
because the front chamber leading into the Aark was =
one large chamber. It
was not until they got further in that it branched of=
f into other sections.

However with a small beep the computer came fully t=
o like. =93Main power
restored.=94 The computer said calmly.

> <OLD>
>
> "=
Mom..."said Elita with fear, and she ran towards the Medical bay,
> she alm=
os couldnt hold her tears. She was fearing that somethign
> really bad had =
happened to her.

<NEW>

Ramulus ran as well to the medical chamber, the wh=
ole way, glancing back at
Elita to be sure that she was keeping up. When th=
ey got there the door was
locked, sealed with a medical privacy code.

=93F=
RAG!=94 he said as he tried the door. =93With the power down it won=92t
rec=
ognize me.=94 Then with a hum the lights began to come on in the hall and
t=
he door began to buzz as it scanned Ramulus. =93Identity Ramulus detected a=
nd
confirmed.=94 The door slid open

Ramulus leaped inside and looked aroun=
d, and in one corner, there was
Nightlight laying on her bed, unconscious, =
but other wise okay. =93O Primus!=94
Ramulus said in relief as he looked ov=
er the readings. =93He was no doctor,
but to him everything looked okay.

M=
eanwhile through the rest of the Ark lights began to flicker and blink as
m=
ain power began to reassert itself. The computer=92s voice could be heard
e=
choing off several panels as it worked through an internal diagnostics
chec=
k, =93Predacon signatures detected.=94

In the room with Perceptor the comp=
uter began quickly pin pointing the
various signatures both inside and with=
in a mile of the Ark outside.

BACK OUTSIDE THE ARK:

At the same time Torc=
a, Noctorro, AirHammer, Quicksilver and Bantor, the
Maximal Fuzors took thi=
s moment of distraction to rush the Predacons cannons
blazing!

Several swe=
eps fell from the skies and Scourge as well took another hit,
this one send=
ing a sizzling burn up the side of his flank.

Cyclonus was also hit, altho=
ugh he was able to twist in the air, turning
what would have normally been =
a devastating blow into one that glanced off
his armor.

Deepstryke was hit=
 several times, forcing him to back off, his boosters
flaring as he began t=
o retreat.

Inferno also was damaged as he took a hit that was designed for=
 Hydras, the
hit sent Inferno spiraling towards the ground as well.

As pow=
erful as the Predacons were, they did not have all their forces there,
and =
the Maximals were finally getting their own forces together. The only
thing=
 that was holding the Predacons together was the sheer power that
Cyclonus =
and Hydras and to a lesser extent Scourge and Deepstyke were
bringing to be=
ar on the Maximals!

That might change with the Ark beginning to power up!
=

(TAG)

Preston
